description.narrative: Strategic Investment Programme (SIP) - Susistainable Land Management Pilot Project Eritrea.
first-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative:
Maekel Region
1. Land distribution 2. Institution capacity building 3. Incentives for marginal lands 4. Income generating activities 5. Affirestation

description.narrative: populated place

activity-description.narrative:
Sub Region Serejeka ( Embadorho, Weki, Guritat,Dekseb, Hayelo......... Villages)
The project will create enabling environment (policy, capacity, knowledge, alternatives) necessary for adoption of Sustainable Land Management SLM) practices and alleviate environmental degradation while improving live

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: A system of knowledge management KM for SLM is developed and used to achieve SLM through mainstreaming of SLM principles into the regional and national development programs projects strategies policies and legislation
10 Zoba and subzoba annual budgets in target area include allocations for replicationadoption of SLM models to new villages and for the extension and implementation of SLM activities

comment.narrative: Baseline information on Zobas and sub zobas budget allocated to SLM practices will be determined during the inception phase
40 increment on their budget for SLM practices

There is no quantitative data allocation of resources for SLM replicationadoption of SLM models However reports Secondary information indicates that the government and the sub region invest on sustainable land management practices such as check dams catchment treatment afforestation and soil and water conservations Sub region allocated 23 million ERN for the establishment of four nursery stations for tree seedling production to be distributed to communities in the project area The nursery can produce over 12 million seedlings a year Sub Zoba covers all related costsexpenses of production and transportation
40 increment on their budget for SLM practices

There is no quantitative data allocation of resources for SLM replicationadoption of SLM models However reports Secondary information indicates that the government and the sub region invest on sustainable land management practices such as check dams catchment treatment afforestation and soil and water conservations Sub region allocated 23 million ERN for the establishment of four nursery stations for tree seedling production to be distributed to communities in the project area The nursery can produce over 12 million seedlings a year Sub Zoba covers all related costsexpenses of production and transportation

description.narrative: 7 Increased knowledge about SLM practices amongst all project key stakeholders SLM platform members

comment.narrative: Knowledge baseline to be established during KCAS development during inception phase Knowledge Awareness survey amongst representative sample of key stakeholder groups
50 of population in 28 pilot villages and 100 of all extension personnel reach knowledge and awareness target set after baseline survey

1696053220 32 community members participated in sustainable land management awareness programmes in all 28 villages and 65 of extension personnel received trainings and acquired good knowledge and awareness of sustainable Land management principles Besides practical and theoretical training on basic GPS application was conducted for 10 days for 23 staffs from Ministry of Agriculture who are directly involved in the land distribution and mapping

description.narrative: 8 Coordinated SLM KM platform operational and self sustaining

comment.narrative: No formal SLMKM platform exists to date
A minimum of 7 SLMKM platforms established 1 national 3 regional and 3 subregional
NO PROGRESS howevercontinuous consultative meetings has been organised with communityvillage land distribution committee and sub zobas for smooth implementation of land distribution
A minimum of 7 SLMKM platforms established 1 national 3 regional and 3 subregional

description.narrative: 9 Evidence of successful mainstreaming of SLM principles in key policies

comment.narrative: The existing draft land use policy does not integrate SLM principles and standards
SLM fully integrated mainstreamed into the new approved land use policy
NO PROGRESS
SLM fully integrated mainstreamed into the new approved land use policy
NO PROGRESS

description.narrative: Capacity building programs and adaptive management systems are developed at all levels for improved governance of SLM particularly enabling grass root community to implement improved SLM
11 of annual increase in budget available for implementation of Capacity Support Strategy and Action plan CSSAP in pilot area

comment.narrative: Baseline value for CSSAP implementation to be determined during CSSAP
Annual increase of at least 15 target value to be verified during baseline assessment including from cofinancing sources

Organisational system on forestry enclosures water and irrigation farm land management at village level has been developed A draft bylaw has been prepared as working reference for the committee Besides continuous training on SLM principles and applications has peen provided to all concerned committees
Annual increase of at least 15 target value to be verified during baseline assessment including from cofinancing sources

description.narrative: 12 No of individuals that apply the through the project developed extension packages

comment.narrative: No extension package available baseline of people who apply packages is 0

80 of all land managers in the 28 pilot villages use the packages additionally more than 150 land managers in replicate areas do so 100 of extension officers in Maekel zoba are knowledgeable about the extension packages and use them in their extension work

As an extension package improved seed varieties has already been distributed wheat potatoes also plant protection chemicals pesticidesinsecticides supplied Almost in all villages the natural resource conservation activities like terracing afforestation farm land terracing animal health service undertaken in the project area

description.narrative: Replicable models of SLM are developed and representative communities use them to manage land in 28 villages of the central highland that are representative of the major agroecological zone for central highlands reducing the rate of land degradation
5 Ratio of source of household incomes in the 28 pilot villages income from agriculture versus other alternative income sources

comment.narrative: Baseline is established Ratio of source of household incomes in the pilot villages ie income from agriculture versus other alternative income sources follows the following pattern 75 of the source of income is derived from agriculture while 25 comes from off farm employment and remittance
Ratios clearly indicate income diversification as a measure of resilience final targets to be established during inception phase

No quantitative available data for this indicator however the proxy indicators shows that increased income generating activities such as bee keeping expansion of woodlots and sale cash income from dales of timber expansion of irrigated crops Vegetables enhanced diversification of income sources and attributed to increase agricultural productionThe proportion of source of household incomes in the pilot villages from agriculture versus other alternative income sources has shown slight shift from baseline situation Estimated 5 increment is observed
Ratios clearly indicate income diversification as a measure of resilience final targets to be established during inception phase

No quantitative available data for this indicator however the proxy indicators shows that increased income generating activities such as bee keeping expansion of woodlots and sale cash income from dales of timber expansion of irrigated crops Vegetables enhanced diversification of income sources and attributed to increase agricultural productionThe proportion of source of household incomes in the pilot villages from agriculture versus other alternative income sources has shown slight shift from baseline situation Estimated 5 increment is observed

description.narrative: 4 Increase in land ha managed through communitylevel SLM plans

comment.narrative:
Currently no communitylevel SLM plans are in place
No of villages with functional SLM plans in place
Area ha managed through application of SLM plans
The management of land in Serejeka subzoba is guided by community level SLM plans the Serejeka subzoba constitutes approximately 240000 ha and 28 villages are situated in the subzoba

No of villages with functional SLM plans in place 5 villages out of 28 528 which covers 18 of the total project area are in place with SLM plan
Area ha managed through application of SLM plans Total area covered is 1974ha Crop land 1005ha and community woodlots 970ha this indicates 9 increment from baseline

description.narrative: 6 No of households in 28 pilot villages benefiting from application of Land Proclamation

comment.narrative: Currently the 1994 Land Proclamation is not applied and 0 households in the pilot area are currently benefiting from its application
More than 50 of rural land based households benefit from private tenure following the provisions of the 1994 Land Proclamation

Land distribution is conducted in five villages and the zero baseline has increased by 23 which is 3313 HH out of 13223 householdsHH has benefited from the new private land tenure system and sustainable land management practices
More than 50 of rural land based households benefit from private tenure following the provisions of the 1994 Land Proclamation

description.narrative: To create the enabling environment policy capacity knowledge alternatives necessary for adoption of sustainable LM practices and alleviate environmental degradation while improving livelihoods of the farming communities of the CHZ
Decrease of population living below the poverty line in Serejeka subzoba

comment.narrative: Currently 66 of the population in Serejeka subzoba live below the poverty line according to the international definition of poverty assessed in xxx through xxx
The poverty rate is reduced to at least 40 in the subzoba

At this stage there is no concrete informationdata available in poverty reduction however proxy estimates in the project area suggests that poverty has reduced slightly due to expansion of irrigation system by 60 increase in agricultural production and other income generating interventions like horticulture sale of vegetables from improved irrigation system and sale of timbers from afforestation interventions
The poverty rate is reduced to at least 40 in the subzoba

At this stage there is no concrete informationdata available in poverty reduction however proxy estimates in the project area suggests that poverty has reduced slightly due to expansion of irrigation system by 60 increase in agricultural production and other income generating interventions like horticulture sale of vegetables from improved irrigation system and sale of timbers from afforestation interventions

description.narrative: 2 Ha of land under new private land tenure arrangements No of villages and area of land covered

comment.narrative: Currently the 1994 Land Proclamation is not applied and 0 ha of land in the Serejeka subzoba are under longterm private ownership tenure
More than 50 of land in the subzoba are under private title following the provisions of the 1994 Land Proclamation
13275 ha of agricultural land are put under the new private land tenure arrangements which belongs to 5 villages
More than 50 of land in the subzoba are under private title following the provisions of the 1994 Land Proclamation

description.narrative: 1 decrease of degraded land area in Serejeka subzoba

comment.narrative:
Relevant baseline values to be established during inception phase measure of current extent of land degradation will include but will not be limited to
Land area ha of subzoba with signs of soil erosion
Ha of land area deforested using longterm time series
Liters of water abstraction for agricultural use irrigation per ha distribution map
Soil fertility levels baselines to be established at pilot village level relevant measures to be determined
Level of NRM yields eg crops
Overall 25 decrease in degraded area individual targets to be developed as per established measure during inception period

Total highlysevere degraded land was 16180ha Baseline
Due to better land tenure system introduction of land management improved irrigation system and afforestation the degraded land relatively stabilised and reduced by 11 on crop lands and 12 on open access grazing land converted to community forestwoodlots
Overall 25 decrease in degraded area individual targets to be developed as per established measure during inception period

Total highlysevere degraded land was 16180ha Baseline
Due to better land tenure system introduction of land management improved irrigation system and afforestation the degraded land relatively stabilised and reduced by 11 on crop lands and 12 on open access grazing land converted to community forestwoodlots
